title: the existence of Alexander’s work on this subject came to the author’s attention for the first time. In subsequent communication and conversation, both parties were surprised at the similarity of some of their findings and the independence of the routes that had been taken. It was agreed that this independence should be maintained, and therefore it may be best for the reader to be referred to Alexander’s work directly for comparison and contrast. Alexander’s two main papers on the subject are ‘Human values and economists’ values’
and ‘Public television and the “ought” of public policy’
